optimized_title: Guinness Supply Dwindles: Liverpool Pubs Ration Beer for Holidays
description: An Irish pub in Liverpool uses an average of 12 50-litre barrels a week. It has now received just half of its order. Across England, there are shortages of the Irish drink. Some bars have been without it since last Friday. Distributors say they are saving up to make it through Christmas and New Year's Eve, especially since the warehouses were emptied during the rugby games.
summary: Due to high demand during sports events, Guinness distributors are rationing beer supplies to ensure availability through the holiday season, causing shortages in English pubs. Some bars have been without the Irish stout since last Friday.

original_title: Auto giant winds down part of business: $10 billion down the drain
optimized_title: GM Halts Robotaxi Project: $10B Loss, Autonomous Focus Shifts to Personal Vehicles
description: General Motors said it would stop funding and end development of a robotaxi at Cruise. The project had cost $10 billion, but GM said it would now focus on developing autonomous systems for use in personal vehicles.
summary: General Motors has decided to halt its robotaxi project by Cruise, incurring a $10 billion loss. The company will now shift its focus towards developing autonomous systems for personal vehicles.

original_title: LPP Group posted PLN 579 million in net profit in Q3, compared to the consensus of PLN 634.6 million
optimized_title: LPP Group's Q3 Net Profit Misses Expectations at PLN 579M
description: The LPP Group had PLN 579 million of net profit of the parent company in the third quarter of the 2024/25 financial year, compared to PLN 576 million a year ago, the company reported in a report. Analysts surveyed by PAP Biznes expected PLN 634.6 million of profit.
summary: LPP Group reported a net profit of PLN 579 million in the third quarter of the 2024/25 financial year, a slight increase from the previous year's PLN 576 million. However, this figure missed analysts' expectations, which were set at PLN 634.6 million.

original_title: Orlen stops Olefina III investment. It was supposed to be PLN 8 billion, but it is over PLN 50 billion
optimized_title: Orlen Halts Olefin III, Redirects PLN 8B to New Chemistry Project
description: The Orlen Management Board has decided to stop the Olefiny III project, the concern informed in a statement. From now on, the work will be carried out as part of the New Chemistry project, in a way that allows for the rationalization of the necessary expenditures.
summary: Orlen has halted the Olefin III investment project, initially estimated at PLN 8 billion, and redirected efforts to the New Chemistry project. The decision aims to rationalize expenses and is expected to exceed PLN 50 billion.

original_title: EPP MEPs call on the EC to withdraw the ban on combustion engines from 2035
optimized_title: EPP MEPs Urge EC to Reverse 2035 Ban on Combustion Cars
description: The European People's Party Group in the European Parliament - which includes PO and PSL - called on the EC on Wednesday to withdraw the ban on the sale of cars with combustion engines from 2035. We demand a return to technological neutrality, MEP Jens Gieseke announced at a press conference in Brussels.
summary: The European People's Party Group in the European Parliament, which includes Polish parties PO and PSL, called on the European Commission to reverse the ban on the sale of cars with combustion engines from 2035, advocating for technological neutrality in the automotive industry.

original_title: Deputy head of the European Commission: In exceptional situations, member states may suspend the right to asylum
optimized_title: EU Vice-President: Temporary Asylum Suspension Allowed in Extreme Circumstances
description: The European Commission's vice-president for security and democracy, Henna Virkkunen, announced on Wednesday that EU countries, defending the security of the Union's borders, can take special measures, such as suspending the right to asylum. These measures must be exceptional and introduced temporarily, she stressed.
summary: The European Commission's vice-president for security and democracy, Henna Virkkunen, announced that EU countries can temporarily suspend the right to asylum in exceptional situations to defend the Union's border security. These measures must be temporary and extreme.

original_title: Russia's 'shadow fleet' of oil transporters targeted, Poland announces new sanctions package
optimized_title: Poland Targets Russia's 'Shadow Fleet' with New Sanctions Package
description: Finance Minister Andrzej Domański said in Brussels that Poland will seek to impose further sanctions on Russia, including the 16th package aimed at illegal trade in Russian oil.
summary: Poland announced its intention to impose new sanctions on Russia, specifically targeting the illegal trade of Russian oil. Finance Minister Andrzej Domański stated this in Brussels, highlighting Poland's continued efforts to restrict Russia's economic activities.

original_title: The Supreme Court’s Extraordinary Control Chamber upheld PiS’s complaint against the National Electoral Commission’s decision to reject the 2023 election report.
optimized_title: Supreme Court Upholds PiS Complaint Against 2023 Election Report Rejection
description: The Supreme Court's Chamber of Extraordinary Control and Public Affairs has upheld PiS's complaint against the decision of the National Electoral Commission to reject the report of that party's committee for the 2023 elections, Supreme Court spokesman Aleksander Stępkowski said on Wednesday.
summary: The Supreme Court's Extraordinary Control Chamber has ruled in favor of the Law and Justice (PiS) party, overturning the National Electoral Commission's rejection of PiS's 2023 election report. This decision follows a complaint filed by PiS, according to the court's spokesman.

original_title: Investigation against former Lotos CEO dismissed. He allegedly exposed the company to losses
optimized_title: Prosecutors Drop Case Against Ex-Lotos CEO Over Alleged Losses
description: The District Prosecutor's Office in Gdańsk has discontinued the investigation into, among others, the former CEO of Grupa Lotos, Paweł Olechnowicz, who was suspected of causing significant financial damage to the company in 2011, the spokesman said on Wednesday.
summary: The District Prosecutor's Office in Gdańsk has dismissed the case against former Grupa Lotos CEO, Paweł Olechnowicz, who was accused of causing significant financial damage to the company in 2011. The investigation has been discontinued.

original_title: Another government approach to the wind farm bill. It may come out of the climate ministry next week
optimized_title: Climate Ministry to Advance Wind Farm Bill Next Week
description: The Ministry of Climate and Environment will be ready to send the draft law liberalizing distance requirements for onshore wind farms to the next stage outside the ministry next week, Minister of Climate and Environment Paulina Hennig-Kloska informed journalists.
summary: The Ministry of Climate and Environment in Poland is set to advance the wind farm bill to its next stage, aiming to liberalize distance requirements for onshore wind farms, according to Minister Paulina Hennig-Kloska. This move is expected to take place next week, signaling a potential shift in renewable energy policies.

original_title: Will the US abolish daylight saving time? The new Trump administration wants it
optimized_title: Trump's Advisers Push to Abolish Daylight Saving Time
description: The US "government efficiency" advisers in the new Donald Trump administration, Elon Musk and Vivek Ramaswamy, are in favor of completely abolishing daylight saving time across the country, the Washington Post reported on Tuesday. It recalled that the US Senate presented a plan in 2022 to make daylight saving time effective year-round.
summary: The new Trump administration, with advisers Elon Musk and Vivek Ramaswamy, is pushing to abolish daylight saving time nationwide in the US. This follows a 2022 Senate proposal to make daylight saving time effective year-round.

original_title: Polish Nuclear Power Plant. First Reactor Launch Date Is Here
optimized_title: Poland's First Nuclear Power Plant: Reactor Launch Set for 2036
description: The update of the Polish Nuclear Power Program envisages the beginning of commercial operation of the first unit of the first Polish nuclear power plant in 2036, announced on Wednesday the government's plenipotentiary for strategic energy infrastructure, Wojciech Wrochna.
summary: Poland's first nuclear power plant is set to begin commercial operations in 2036, according to the government's plenipotentiary for strategic energy infrastructure, Wojciech Wrochna. This update is part of the Polish Nuclear Power Program and marks a significant step in Poland's energy diversification efforts.

original_title: Media pluralism is the foundation of democracy." US ambassador to Poland speaks out after TVN decision
optimized_title: US Ambassador: Media Pluralism Crucial for Democracy Amid Security Threats
description: Media pluralism is the foundation of democracy. In the face of global challenges related to foreign, harmful interference, it is important for governments to take action to protect strategic infrastructure from potential threats to national security, said U.S. Ambassador to Poland Mark Brzezinski.
summary: U.S. Ambassador to Poland Mark Brzezinski emphasized the importance of media pluralism for a strong democracy, especially in the face of global security threats. He urged governments to protect strategic infrastructure from foreign interference to safeguard national security.

original_title: Further sanctions against Russia. EU countries have adopted the 15th package
optimized_title: EU Adopts 15th Package of Sanctions Against Russia
description: Ambassadors of member states to the EU have adopted the 15th package of sanctions against Russia, an EU source told journalists in Brussels. To enter into force, it must still be supported by foreign ministers at the EU Council meeting on Monday.
summary: The European Union has adopted the 15th package of sanctions against Russia, with the approval of ambassadors from member states. This package still needs to be ratified by foreign ministers at an upcoming EU Council meeting to take effect.

original_title: Ukraine's Finance Minister: We have the means to wage war until mid-2025
optimized_title: Ukraine's Finance Minister: We Can Fight Until Mid-2025
description: We have enough funds and weapons to resist Russian troops at least until the middle of next year, Ukrainian Finance Minister Serhiy Marchenko said in an interview with Spanish daily El Pais on Wednesday.
summary: In an interview with Spanish daily El Pais, Ukrainian Finance Minister Serhiy Marchenko stated that Ukraine has sufficient funds and weapons to resist Russian troops until at least mid-2025.

original_title: Farmers skeptical about Mercosur deal. Brazilian beef with hormones "on the fork" of EU officials
optimized_title: EU Farmers Skeptical Over Mercosur Deal: Hormone-Free Brazilian Beef in Question
description: The European Commission published some of the documents that make up the free trade agreement between the EU and Mercosur countries on Wednesday. The agreement includes a system that will ensure that beef imported to the EU from Brazil was produced without the use of hormones banned in the EU, the EC assured.
summary: The European Commission released documents detailing the EU-Mercosur free trade agreement, aiming to ensure hormone-free Brazilian beef imports. However, EU farmers remain skeptical about the deal and the effectiveness of the system to guarantee hormone-free imports.

original_title: Klimczak: Start of construction of the Warsaw bypass one of the biggest challenges for the Ministry of Infrastructure
optimized_title: Minister Klimczak: Warsaw Bypass Construction Among Major Challenges for Infrastructure Ministry
description: The commencement of construction of the Warsaw agglomeration bypass or the expansion of the railway network are the greatest challenges facing the Ministry of Infrastructure, said the head of the ministry, Dariusz Klimczak, on Wednesday during a conference summarizing the ministry's year of work.
summary: Minister Klimczak highlighted that the start of construction for the Warsaw bypass and the expansion of the railway network are significant challenges for the Ministry of Infrastructure. He made these comments during a conference reviewing the ministry's year of work.

original_title: Half a year with in vitro reimbursement in Poland. "Almost 7 thousand pregnancies, 20 thousand couples in the procedure
optimized_title: In Vitro Reimbursement in Poland: 6,752 Pregnancies, 20,000 Couples Treated
description: Thanks to the in vitro reimbursement program, 6,752 women are currently pregnant, and 20,000 couples have qualified for infertility treatment using this method, said Izabela Leszczyna, the Minister of Health, on Wednesday. After six months of the program, Poland has advanced from 42nd to 19th place in the European Infertility Treatment Atlas.
summary: Poland's in vitro reimbursement program has led to 6,752 pregnancies and helped 20,000 couples access infertility treatment. The country has moved up in rankings from 42nd to 19th in the European Infertility Treatment Atlas after six months of implementation.

original_title: Record coffee prices. Wholesale prices have gone up by 80 percent, and that's not the end of the increases
optimized_title: Coffee Prices Soar: Wholesale Costs Up 80% in 2024
description: On Tuesday, half a kilogram of Arabica was priced at $3.44 on international commodity markets. Robusta beans are also seeing similar growth in purchase costs. This means that coffee prices have risen by over 80% in 2024 alone. This, in turn, will translate into retail prices. Will coffee become a luxury alongside butter?
summary: Coffee prices have surged significantly in 2024, with wholesale costs of Arabica and Robusta beans increasing by over 80%. This rise is set to impact retail prices, potentially making coffee a luxury item akin to butter.

original_title: President of the National Health Fund: There is no guarantee that we will pay for overperformance [INTERVIEW]
optimized_title: **National Health Fund Chief: No Guarantee for Overperformance Payments**
description: - Politics has its own rules, and we, as a public institution, must manage money rationally - says Filip Nowak, president of the National Health Fund, in an interview for Dziennik Gazeta Prawna.
summary: The President of the National Health Fund in Poland, Filip Nowak, stated in an interview that there is no guarantee for payments related to overperformance due to the need to manage public funds rationally. He emphasized that the rules of politics necessitate responsible financial management.

original_title: Duda and Tusk will go to Trump together [OPINION]
optimized_title: Duda and Tusk to Meet Trump: Polish Security Policy Unchanged
description: The most important area of ​​Polish policy – ​​security – was largely a continuation of what the United Right had started last year. Neither the modernization of the army, the protection of the border with Belarus, nor relations with Ukraine were subject to revision. No significant arms contracts were terminated. The South Korean direction is continued.
summary: The article discusses the continuity in Polish security policy under the new government, highlighting that key areas such as army modernization, border protection with Belarus, and relations with Ukraine remain unchanged. It also mentions that no significant arms contracts have been terminated, and the South Korean direction in security cooperation is being continued.

original_title: Hazardous waste clean-up. Plans include support from earmarked reserve
optimized_title: Ministry to Tackle Hazardous Waste Cleanup with Earmarked Funds
description: In January, the Ministry of Climate will begin work on designating the first hazardous waste for removal.
summary: The Ministry of Climate is set to start a project in January to designate and remove hazardous waste. The initiative will be supported by funds from an earmarked reserve.

original_title: PiS complaint upheld. Supreme Court decision
optimized_title: Supreme Court Upholds PiS Complaint Against Election Ruling
description: The Supreme Court’s Chamber of Extraordinary Control has decided to uphold the complaint filed by Law and Justice against the National Electoral Commission’s decision to reject the report of the party’s electoral committee on the 2023 parliamentary elections.
summary: The Supreme Court in Poland has upheld a complaint by the Law and Justice (PiS) party against the National Electoral Commission's decision to reject their electoral report for the 2023 parliamentary elections. This decision by the Chamber of Extraordinary Control is significant as it potentially impacts the upcoming elections and the political landscape in Poland.

original_title: TVN and Polsat as strategic companies. The internet is in a frenzy. "A new Bierut decree?", "an uneducated gang", "caring for the good of Poland
optimized_title: Tusk Declares TVN, Polsat Strategic; Spark Debate
description: Donald Tusk announced today that TVN and Polsat will be placed on the list of strategic companies that are subject to protection against, for example, takeovers that are dangerous from the point of view of the interests of the Polish state. This news divided politicians and experts. Dr. Michał Sopiński asked on the X service whether we are dealing with a new Bierut decree.
summary: Donald Tusk, a key Polish politician, declared TVN and Polsat as strategic companies, sparking debate among politicians and experts. Critics like Dr. Michał Sopiński compared the move to ahistorical decrees, questioning its motives and implications for the Polish state.

original_title: A Difficult Start to Adulthood: Young Poles at Risk of Poverty
optimized_title: Poland's Young Adults: Struggling with Poverty and Exclusion
description: The group most affected by poverty and social exclusion in Poland are currently the so-called "young adults". Experts point out the need for systemic support for those most in need.
summary: The article highlights that young adults in Poland face the highest risks of poverty and social exclusion. Experts emphasize the necessity of comprehensive support systems to assist this vulnerable group.

original_title: TVN and Polsat will be on the list of strategic companies. Tusk decided
optimized_title: **"TVN and Polsat Named Strategic Companies by Tusk"**
description: TVN and Polsat will be placed on the list of strategic companies that are subject to protection, e.g. against aggressive and dangerous, from the point of view of state interests, takeovers. Donald Tusk: Without the consent of the Polish government, it will not be possible to take over or buy these companies.
summary: TVN and Polsat have been designated as strategic companies by Donald Tusk, requiring government consent for any acquisitions or takeovers to protect state interests from hostile transactions.

original_title: Concluding an Online Contract: What You Need to Know to Avoid Being Scammed!
optimized_title: Master Online Contracts: Stay Safe from Scams
description: Nowadays, more and more transactions are made online. Online shopping, digital services, subscriptions or reservations - all of this has become part of our everyday life. However, concluding a contract online involves a certain risk. In order not to be fooled, it is worth knowing the legal basis and rules that govern contracts concluded online.
summary: This content discusses the legal aspects of online contracts, highlighting the importance of understanding the rules and regulations to avoid scams. It emphasizes the commonality of online transactions and the necessity of being informed to protect oneself legally.

original_title: Unconscious mistakes in your will can cost your loved ones a fortune! Find out what to avoid
optimized_title: Avoid Costly Will Mistakes: Protect Your Loved Ones' Inheritance
description: A will is a key document in the inheritance process, allowing each person to decide independently how to divide their estate after death. Unfortunately, even minor formal errors or lack of knowledge of the rules of inheritance can lead to conflicts between heirs, invalidation of the will, and even complicated legal proceedings. In this article, we present the most common mistakes made when preparing wills and practical tips on how to avoid them.
summary: This article discusses common mistakes people make when drafting their wills, which can lead to conflicts among heirs and legal complications. It provides practical tips to avoid these errors and ensure a smooth inheritance process.

original_title: Who is entitled to the widow's pension? ZUS is responsible
optimized_title: Claiming Widow's Pension: ZUS Outlines Eligibility Criteria
description: The Social Insurance Institution has issued a statement in which it presents the conditions that must be met in order to receive the so-called widow's pension. For this purpose, the potential beneficiary can complete a questionnaire available on the ZUS website. Who can benefit from combining the payment of a family pension with another benefit? We answer.
summary: The Social Insurance Institution (ZUS) in Poland has outlined the criteria for receiving a widow's pension. Beneficiaries can complete an online questionnaire on the ZUS website to determine their eligibility and explore the possibility of combining this pension with other benefits.

original_title: 4,500 PLN tax refund for everyone. Check what you need to do
optimized_title: Boost Your Tax Refund: Claim Up to 4,500 PLN by Saving for Retirement
description: It is possible to get a tax refund of up to PLN 4,500. Simply start saving for retirement under tax relief to take advantage of the available benefits. With simple actions, you can significantly increase your tax refund in next year's settlement.
summary: The article discusses how Polish citizens can boost their tax refunds by up to 4,500 PLN by saving for retirement under tax relief. Simple actions can significantly increase the tax refund in the next year's settlement.

original_title: Gift Tax? Check when you can get a summons from the tax office!
optimized_title: Gift Tax Alert: When to Report & Avoid Summons
description: Receiving gifts is a joyful moment, but in some cases it may involve the need to settle tax formalities. The Polish tax system requires that gifts or donations received be reported to the tax office if their value exceeds certain thresholds. Failure to do so may result in a summons from the tax office or even penalties. Check when gift tax is required and how to avoid problems with the tax office.
summary: The article discusses the requirements for reporting gifts or donations in Poland under the gift tax system. It highlights that gifts exceeding certain value thresholds must be reported to the tax office to avoid potential summons or penalties. The article aims to inform readers about when gift tax is applicable and how to comply with the tax regulations.

original_title: Orlen stops construction of Olefin. This will save from loss of PLN 15 billion
optimized_title: Orlen Halts Olefina III Project, Saves PLN 15 Billion
description: Orlen's board announced today that it has halted the Olefina III investment due to excessively high costs. The company argues that this will protect it from a loss of approximately PLN 15 billion. The company's management announced that it has informed the prosecutor's office about the irregularities.
summary: Orlen has halted the Olefina III project due to high costs, preventing a potential loss of PLN 15 billion. The company has also reported irregularities to the prosecutor's office.
